subject: packaging: fix build failure of arm
commitMessage:
packaging: fix build failure of arm

This patch adds a space to fix wrong conjoined options.

Unknown option "--disable-mmx--extra-cflags=-mfpu=neon".

subject: libavformat/mpegts: expose raw packet size
commitMessage:
libavformat/mpegts: expose raw packet size

We cannot easily determine if an mpeg TS's packet size is DVHS, FEC
or so on, for that we need to expose the internal raw_packet_size
field.

Change-Id: I3eb179703b62748ae8bec6bd85a50760c0bc6d84

comments.message:
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Was posted upstream as well.

Patch Set 1:

does upstream accept this patch yet?

Patch Set 1:

It would be nice to have bug url in commit message ... to link to upstream feedback if any...

Patch Set 1:

Patch was already upstream merged.

http://git.videolan.org/?p=ffmpeg.git;a=commit;h=f9b997c337873dad99f7fd505588b260febaf32b

Patch Set 1:

thanks for the link, two opens:
1) why not submit to libav upstream as well? we'd like to keep as less as local patches in Tizen, if this is a upstream package.

2) any specific bug in Tizen JIRA will this commit fix?

Patch Set 1:

There is no directly related Jira issue for this patch. There's an upstream package (lightmediascanner) that depends on this patch.

Patch Set 1:

Btw, I'll route the patch to libav.

Patch Set 1:

thanks for doing this, please help post a message when it's accepted in upstream, so that next upgrading of libav for Tizen could have it.

Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Tip: You can add some dep3 tags to track coop with upstream :

https://wiki.tizen.org/wiki/Talk:Packaging/Guidelines#PROPOSAL

Patch Set 1:

The patch was accepted upstream. In the process of getting the patch integrated we needed to redefine some internal structures on libav, so the integrated patch looks a little different.

http://git.libav.org/?p=libav.git;a=commit;h=8370a6fa59429e420999a738bc6c0d5a6ac4003a

Patch Set 1:

Then you can add :

Origin: http://git.libav.org/?p=libav.git;a=commit;h=8370a6fa59429e420999a738bc6c0d5a6ac4003a

And please sign-off your commit

Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

The upstream commit of this patch has been cherry-picked and pushed, thanks.
Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2
Patch Set 1: Verified+1

The change could not be merged due to a path conflict.

Please rebase the change locally and upload the rebased commit for review.

The change could not be merged due to a path conflict.

Please rebase the change locally and upload the rebased commit for review.
Uploaded patch set 2.
Change has been successfully pushed.

subject: Fix aarch64 build
commitMessage:
Fix aarch64 build

Remove flags with NEON when compiling for aarch64.

Change-Id: I201b170a097be2b1fa133639ef2a0e140158f8e1
Signed-off-by: Yury Usishchev <y.usishchev@samsung.com>

comments.message: Uploaded patch set 1.

Patch Set 1: Verified+1

This patch does not break armv7l and i586 build and enables aarch64 build. Build results can be found here: patched( https://build.tizen.org/package/show?package=libav&project=devel%3Aarm_toolchain%3AMobile%3Atest ) and original( https://build.tizen.org/package/show?package=libav_fail&project=devel%3Aarm_toolchain%3AMobile%3Atest )

Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Waited for enough time without any negative feedback.
Force merging the aarch64 compatibility patch.
Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.

subject: add install script to substitute prefix in a pc file on Windows.
commitMessage:
add install script to substitute prefix in a pc file on Windows.

PKG_CONFIG_PATH overrides a prefix variable in a .pc file on Windows.
That is why the variable is replaced with empty value.

add disable-yasm option

until checking that its option improves performance of video decoders.

subject: modify SDK build scripts
commitMessage:
modify SDK build scripts

When each build script copied libraries into a package on Linux and Mac,
symbolic link file did not copy its source file.
In addition to this, modify loader path of those libraries on Mac
because of linking problem.

subject: build: fixes a "can't cd to..." issue when installing shared libraries.

The problem is reproducible with a relative prefix path.
